page.title: 07COMMUNICATIONS - DUNURE
page.content: The Telephone Exchange owned by British Telecom is situated beside Fisherton Primary School.This is on A719.It is a relatively small Exchange visited regularly by local telephone engineer.The Radio Station is also owned by British Telecom and is situated approximately 250 yards from the school at the top of a road locally known as "Coal Pit Road".This station uses Microwave technique for the transmission of telephone calls across the Firth of Clyde to Arran and Mull of Kintyre.The transmitter and receiver aerials are mounted on steel structures approximately 80 metres high which look like large saucers but are in fact called "Dish Arrays".
